calculation here is that, look, this has been

1299.text:
a very difficult year for Republicans, this
is probably going to be a very difficult general

1301.text: And he’s got a longer view.

1302.text:
He’s a young guy, he can run in 2020, he
can run in 2024.

1303.text:
I mean, he’s got lots of years ahead of
him.

1306.text:
And more importantly, he right now really
is the face of Republicanism that is not in

1312.text:
And I think he’s preparing himself to be
able to pick up the pieces no matter what

1317.text:
WILLIAMS: But very briefly, let me ask you
for a quick answer.

1318.text:
He’s going to be the chairman of the convention,
though, right?

1321.text:
Does that give him any power, or does he just
say hello and goodbye?

1325.text:
Well, most years that would be the case if
there wasn’t a contested convention.

1327.text:
But this year he’s actually going to sit
there with the gavel and have to sort things

1331.text: There may be motions from the floor.

1332.text:
There may be other disputes to settle, and
he’ll have to do that.

1336.text:
WILLIAMS: But he doesn’t have any behind-the-scenes
role here?

1344.text:
O’KEEFE: He won’t be the kingmaker necessarily,
but he is the one that might tell the campaigns

1345.text:
get your act together and let’s settle this
on the next ballot.

1347.text: MARTIN: He’ll have a voice, yeah.

1349.text:
SCHERER: And one of the interesting dramas
here is, like, normally the convention is

1350.text: designed by the candidate in waiting, right?

1352.text:
And we’re going to probably be going into
a convention –

1355.text: MARTIN: With no candidate in waiting.

1357.text: SCHERER: – without a candidate in waiting.

1358.text:
So you know, Reince Priebus is going to be
pricking the drapes and figuring out, you

1367.text:
SCHERER: And Ryan will be sitting next to
Reince.

1368.text:
I think the chairman of the Republican Party
is going to have an enormous amount of power.

1369.text:
And the extent to which they work together,
both from Wisconsin, they’re old friends,

1370.text:
they know each other very well, Ryan will
definitely have a say.

1372.text:
WILLIAMS: So he’ll be – this is his audition
then?

1384.text:
No comment, that’ll have to wrap it up for
tonight.

1385.text:
But be sure to check out the Washington Week
Webcast Extra, where Michael will tell us

1386.text:
the impact that the Broadway hit Hamilton
is having on the United States Treasury decision

1393.text:
That’s at PBS.org/WashingtonWeek, later
tonight and all weekend long.

1397.text:
Be sure to keep up with daily developments
on the PBS NewsHour, and look for us around

1402.text: the table again next week on Washington Week.
